STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 9, 2025
Jennifer Claire Milliman
FOSTERING FUTURES
2008 Hogback Rd., Suite 6
Ann Arbor, MI. 48105-9751
RE: License#: CB810302599
Dear Ms. Milliman:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 7/8/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samatha Way, area manager, at WayS1@michigan.gov.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the
development of service plans to enable the
parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the
parents' and the foster parent's role in assisting
the agency in carrying out the plan. An agency
shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and
the child's family is confidential.
Seven of eight foster care case records reviewed did not indicate that the plan
was developed with the parent/parents or foster parents to enable the
parent/parents/foster parents to understand the plan.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim 2024, CAP Approved 11/4/2024

CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
days of the family signing an adoption
application and prior to approving a family for
adoption.
One of three adoptive family evaluation case records reviewed did not complete
the report within 90 days of the signed application.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: One
CAP submitted was in response to the 2024 interim inspection completed on
10/10/2024 and the CAP was approved on 11/4/2024. The agency was cited for 3
violations, 1 of the violations is a repeat this year. The repeated violation
(400.12418 -5) indicates that additional corrective action planning is needed to
show reduction of this violation.
A special investigation #2025SIC0000006 was initiated on 10/2/2024. The report
was completed on 11/21/2024, and the CAP was approved on 1/14/2025. The
agency was in violation of rule 400.12421 -1 Visitation and family time: in person.
There was not a repeat violation of this rule during this audit.

Chief Administrator Assessment:
Chief Administrator (CA) discussed barriers that impeded the agency this year
during the exit conference held on 7/8/2025. CA reported that late signatures
continue to be a challenge due to the time it can take a worker to follow up with
printing and signing completed reports, sometimes being a week or more, which
leads to the report not going with them on home visits and missing the 30 - day
window for obtaining the signatures. She reported the agency has started a new
practice of supervisors printing and signing reports, and the accompanying
medical passports, as soon as they approve them so they can immediately be
prepared to go on home visits with staff. She is hoping this will assist in the
reports being signed timelier.
Financial Overview:
Reviewed the agency independent auditor’s report dated December 31, 2023, and
2022, and the agency annual financial report. There were no financial concerns
identified.
Staff Interviews:
Staff were interviewed onsite 6/11/2025. Staff interviewed were very
compassionate about working for the agency citing the assistance, support they
receive from the administration, supervisors, and their co-workers. The staff
interviewed did not have any concerns. They feel the environment is good to work
in and that they can go to any department in the agency and get assistance if
needed.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has the space and equipment needed to fulfil job requirements. The
files are stored securely to prevent unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert.
Safety Alert:
The caregiver home is missing a carbon monoxide detector.
Resolution:
On 6/24/2025, the Foster Care Worker brought a smoke detector to the caregiver’s
home and verified its installation. The Caregiver agreed to ensure its use in the
home. Photo is uploaded.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
7/9/2025
______________________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
7/9/2025

Samantha Way Date
